intro: Fumaria neapolitana, commonly known as the Naples cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Fumaria neapolitana is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and historical use in herbal medicine.
